SENT.plain: The balance between heat production (metabolism) and heat removal (blood flow) helps in keeping the temperature of the brain constant
In patients with moyamoya disease, this balance may be disturbed
The purpose of this study was to assess the thermal pathophysiology of the brain in patients with moyamoya disease
The study included 12 consecutive patients with moyamoya disease and 10 controls
Temperature was measured by image postprocessing of diffusion-weighted images
Our noninvasive thermometry showed that the ventricular temperature of moyamoya disease patients was higher than that of normal controls
The mean temperature difference of 1.1 degrees C between the two groups was significant
Patients with moyamoya disease tend to have elevated ventricular temperatures, which may represent a mismatch between cerebral metabolism and perfusion
